Description: Shoulder and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Milesian Pre-Fikellura pottery vessel, probably krater; white slip; exterior: on shoulder, band of pendent lotus flowers and buds, with some added red, not easily distinguished from thicker areas of glaze; below, a scatter of glaze blobs; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd almost certainly belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1886,0401.688, which also has a blob in the field. The number in Petrie is written in ink, '334', on the exterior of the sherd. Cook suggests that the sherd may not be Fikellura. In her unpublished thesis on Milesian kraters Panataleon (p.360) argues for an early date and for a krater; the early lettering of the graffito, despite the developed epsilon, points in this direction.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 9, no. 3, pl. 9, no. 3)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 334)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 121, no. 182)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 671, no. 295)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 242, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.038)
